requestBody.description: The structure that can be imported to or exported from Otoroshi. It represent the memory state of Otoroshi

admins.description: Current U2F admin at the time of export

items.description: Administrator using FIDO U2F device to access Otoroshi

createdAt.description: The creation date of the user

password.description: The hashed password of the user

username.description: The email address of the user

apiKeys.description: Current apik keys at the time of export

items.description: An Otoroshi Api Key. An Api Key is defined for a group of services to allow usage of the same Api Key for multiple services.

authorizedGroup.description: The group id on which the key is authorized

clientId.description: The unique id of the Api Key. Usually 16 random alpha numerical characters, but can be anything

clientName.description: The name of the api key, for humans ;-)

clientSecret.description: The secret of the Api Key. Usually 64 random alpha numerical characters, but can be anything

dailyQuota.description: Authorized number of calls per day

enabled.description: Whether or not the key is enabled. If disabled, resources won't be available to calls using this key

metadata.description: Bunch of metadata for the key

monthlyQuota.description: Authorized number of calls per month

throttlingQuota.description: Authorized number of calls per second, measured on 10 seconds

appConfig.description: Current env variables at the time of export

config.description: Current global config at the time of export

alertsEmails.description: Email addresses that will receive all Otoroshi alert events

alertsWebhooks.description: Webhook that will receive all Otoroshi alert events

items.description: A callback URL where events are posted

headers.description: Headers to authorize the call or whatever

url.description: The URL where events are posted

analyticsEventsUrl.description: The URL to get analytics events from

analyticsWebhooks.description: Webhook that will receive all internal Otoroshi events

items.description: A callback URL where events are posted

headers.description: Headers to authorize the call or whatever

url.description: The URL where events are posted

apiReadOnly.description: If enabled, Admin API won't be able to write/update/delete entities

autoLinkToDefaultGroup.description: If not defined, every new service descriptor will be added to the default group

backofficeAuth0Config.description: Optional configuration for the backoffice Auth0 domain

endlessIpAddresses.description: IP addresses for which any request to Otoroshi will respond with 128 Gb of zeros

ipFiltering.description: The filtering configuration block for a service of globally.

limitConcurrentRequests.description: If enabled, Otoroshi will reject new request if too much at the same time

maxConcurrentRequests.description: The number of authorized request processed at the same time

maxHttp10ResponseSize.description: The max size in bytes of an HTTP 1.0 response

middleFingers.description: Use middle finger emoji as a response character for endless HTTP responses

perIpThrottlingQuota.description: Authorized number of calls per second globally per IP address, measured on 10 seconds

privateAppsAuth0Config.description: Optional configuration for the private apps Auth0 domain

streamEntityOnly.description: HTTP will be streamed only. Doesn't work with old browsers

throttlingQuota.description: Authorized number of calls per second globally, measured on 10 seconds

u2fLoginOnly.description: If enabled, login to backoffice through Auth0 will be disabled

useCircuitBreakers.description: If enabled, services will be authorized to use circuit breakers

errorTemplates.description: Current error templates at the time of export

items.description: Error templates for a service descriptor

serviceId.description: The Id of the service for which the error template is enabled

templateBuild.description: The html template for build page

templateMaintenance.description: The html template for maintenance page

serviceDescriptors.description: Current service descriptors at the time of export

items.description: An otoroshi service descriptor. Represent a forward HTTP call on a domain to another location with some optional api management mecanism

Canary.description: The configuration of the canary mode for a service descriptor

enabled.description: Use canary mode for this service

root.description: Otoroshi will append this root to any target choosen. If the specified root is '/api/foo', then a request to https://yyyyyyy/bar will actually hit https://xxxxxxxxx/api/foo/bar

targets.description: The list of target that Otoroshi will proxy and expose through the subdomain defined before. Otoroshi will do round-robin load balancing between all those targets with circuit breaker mecanism to avoid cascading failures

items.description: A Target is where an HTTP call will be forwarded in the end from a service domain

host.description: The host on which the HTTP call will be forwarded. Can be a domain name, or an IP address. Can also have a port

scheme.description: The protocol used for communication. Can be http or https

traffic.description: Ratio of traffic that will be sent to canary targets.

additionalHeaders.description: Specify headers that will be added to each client request. Useful to add authentication

api.description: The Open API configuration for your service (if one)

exposeApi.description: Whether or not the current service expose an API with an Open API descriptor

openApiDescriptorUrl.description: The URL of the Open API descriptor

buildMode.description: Display a construction page when a user try to use the service

clientConfig.description: The configuration of the circuit breaker for a service descriptor

backoffFactor.description: Specify the factor to multiply the delay for each retry

callTimeout.description: Specify how long each call should last at most in milliseconds

globalTimeout.description: Specify how long the global call (with retries) should last at most in milliseconds

maxErrors.description: Specify how many errors can pass before opening the circuit breaker

retries.description: Specify how many times the client will try to fetch the result of the request after an error before giving up.

retryInitialDelay.description: Specify the delay between two retries. Each retry, the delay is multiplied by the backoff factor

sampleInterval.description: Specify the sliding window time for the circuit breaker in milliseconds, after this time, error count will be reseted

useCircuitBreaker.description: Use a circuit breaker to avoid cascading failure when calling chains of services. Highly recommended !

domain.description: The domain on which the service is available.

enabled.description: Activate or deactivate your service. Once disabled, users will get an error page saying the service does not exist

enforceSecureCommunication.description: When enabled, Otoroshi will try to exchange headers with downstream service to ensure no one else can use the service from outside

env.description: The line on which the service is available. Based on that value, the name of the line will be appended to the subdomain. For line prod, nothing will be appended. For example, if the subdomain is 'foo' and line is 'preprod', then the exposed service will be available at 'foo.preprod.mydomain'

forceHttps.description: Will force redirection to https:// if not present

groupId.description: Each service descriptor is attached to a group. A group can have one or more services. Each API key is linked to a group and allow access to every service in the group

healthCheck.description: The configuration for checking health of a service. Otoroshi will perform GET call on the URL to check if the service is still alive

enabled.description: Whether or not healthcheck is enabled on the current service descriptor

id.description: A unique random string to identify your service

ipFiltering.description: The filtering configuration block for a service of globally.

localHost.description: The host used localy, mainly localhost:xxxx

localScheme.description: The scheme used localy, mainly http

maintenanceMode.description: Display a maintainance page when a user try to use the service

matchingHeaders.description: Specify headers that MUST be present on client request to route it. Useful to implement versioning

matchingRoot.description: The root path on which the service is available

metadata.description: Just a bunch of random properties

name.description: The name of your service. Only for debug and human readability purposes

privateApp.description: When enabled, user will be allowed to use the service (UI) only if they are registered users of the private apps domain

privatePatterns.description: If you define a public pattern that is a little bit too much, you can make some of public URL private again

publicPatterns.description: By default, every services are private only and you'll need an API key to access it. However, if you want to expose a public UI, you can define one or more public patterns (regex) to allow access to anybody. For example if you want to allow anybody on any URL, just use '/.*'

redirectToLocal.description: If you work locally with Otoroshi, you may want to use that feature to redirect one particuliar service to a local host. For example, you can relocate https://foo.preprod.bar.com to http://localhost:8080 to make some tests

root.description: Otoroshi will append this root to any target choosen. If the specified root is '/api/foo', then a request to https://yyyyyyy/bar will actually hit https://xxxxxxxxx/api/foo/bar

secComExcludedPatterns.description: URI patterns excluded from secured communications

sendOtoroshiHeadersBack.description: When enabled, Otoroshi will send headers to consumer like request id, client latency, overhead, etc ...

statsdConfig.description: The configuration for statsd metrics push

host.description: The host of the StatsD agent

port.description: The port of the StatsD agent

subdomain.description: The subdomain on which the service is available

targets.description: The list of target that Otoroshi will proxy and expose through the subdomain defined before. Otoroshi will do round-robin load balancing between all those targets with circuit breaker mecanism to avoid cascading failures

items.description: A Target is where an HTTP call will be forwarded in the end from a service domain

host.description: The host on which the HTTP call will be forwarded. Can be a domain name, or an IP address. Can also have a port

scheme.description: The protocol used for communication. Can be http or https

serviceGroups.description: Current service groups at the time of export

items.description: An Otoroshi service group is just a group of service descriptor. It is useful to be able to define Api Keys for the whole group

id.description: The unique id of the group. Usually 64 random alpha numerical characters, but can be anything

simpleAdmins.description: Current simple admins at the time of export

items.description: Administrator using just login/password tuple to access Otoroshi

createdAt.description: The creation date of the user

password.description: The hashed password of the user

username.description: The email address of the user

stats.description: Current global stats at the time of export

calls.description: Number of calls to Otoroshi globally

dataIn.description: The amount of data sent to Otoroshi globally

dataOut.description: The amount of data sent from Otoroshi globally
